New Records: Rodrygo scored the winning goal for Brazil in their 1-0 victory over Ecuador
Key Match Events: Rodrygo scored the winning goal in the 29th minute
Gabriel Magalhães denied Moisés Caicedo's effort with a last-minute goal-line clearance
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil was looking to get back to winning ways after a streak of losses in three successive qualifiers
Post-Match Reflections: Rodrygo said the team needed the win and he was happy with the victory
Brazil will face Paraguay at Asuncion on Tuesday while Ecuador is set to host Peru in Quito on Monday
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ecuador applied physically aggressive pressure high with three hardworking forwards
Brazil dominated possession but failed to create clear chances throughout the match
Others: The match was played at Couto Pereira in Curitiba, Brazil with an attendance of 36,914
